wikipedia_page.main: Henry Sharratt (1936 – June 8th, 2018) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played at representative level for England (Juniors), and Yorkshire (Juniors), and at club level for Stanley Rangers ARLFC, Wakefield Trinity (Heritage № 647), Featherstone Rovers (Heritage № 406), Bradford Northern, Dewsbury and Batley as a wing, centre, prop or second-row, i.e. number 2 or 5, 3 or 4, 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested scrums.

response: *Henry Sharratt,  English  rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s
